text: hi this is Seema and I am back with a
new lesson on expressions using the word
book well we all know what a book is
well a book is you know a bunch of pages
bundled together but when you are
talking about or using expressions using
the word book the meaning takes on a
whole different level okay so let's look
at a few expressions or words with the
word book the first one is to try every
trick in the book well what is it to try
every trick in the book when I use this
expression I am saying that I have tried
every possible way of achieving
something so let's say you have tried to
set up a business okay and your business
is not doing very well it's kind of you
know giving you a little bit of profits
but you want to make it work very bad
you want to be a very successful
businessman or a businesswoman so you
will try every trick in the book to
accomplish the the task of making your
business work very well in other words
you will try every possible way or the
best way possible of achieving something
in your case achieving success in your
business and and the next expression
talks about being an open book now an
open book is an expression when you are
talking about a person and we're talking
about a person who is honest
and someone who doesn't hide their
feelings or emotions so you know there
are some people you can always tell what
they're thinking by just looking at
their face because they don't really
hide anything they don't really hide
what they're feeling what their emotions
are all about so those people are an
open book
so I can say something like Julia is an
open book you just know everything about
her so Julia is probably an honest
person and she's definitely a person who
is not very good at hiding her feelings
or her emotions and then we have the
other expression which is wrote the book
or to write a book in the present tense
what is it when we say someone wrote the
book I am basically saying that someone
has a very detailed or a complete
knowledge about a particular topic so
for example someone wants to get into a
career in medicine okay and you know
this other person say mr. Smith who has
you know been in the medicine career for
like say 10 years so you will tell your
friend if you want to get advice on
medicine go and speak to mr. Smith he
practically wrote the book on medicine
now this person has not actually written
the book but writing the book clearly
means that he has complete or detailed
information or knowledge about that
particular field that particular topic
and our next expression is borrow a page
of someone's book okay so I have a book
and I just take out a page of it is that
what it means no okay when you have a
a book and someone borders a page of out
of that book it basically means that you
imitate someone because he is successful
so you know this person you know your
classmate who always tops the class and
you wonder why I'll tell you why he tops
the class because he always gets up on
time he studies two hours he does his
homework he he does whatever has to be
done to get the best marks in class and
that is why he is very successful now
you will want to imitate him because he
is successful so in other words you can
say I wanted to borrow a page out of you
know mr. Smith's book because he is very
successful so when you are imitating
someone because you see that they are
successful and you want to be successful
too you are borrowing a page of their
book okay and and the next expression is
a bookworm okay well I am a bookworm and
a bookworm is nothing but describing a
person who loves to read so people like
me bookworms we read almost ten books
maybe in a span of two months you know
two weeks or maybe just three weeks so
someone who is really into reading as a
hobby really is a bookworm someone who
loves to read and then we have one for
the record books okay what is it when I
say one for the record books now when
I'm creating a record or achieving
something remarkable
that's what one for the record books
means so how do you use this expression
okay so suppose in my brother who eats a
lot he ate like say 10 burgers in a day
now that's a remarkable achievement
because I don't know anyone who eats 10
hamburgers in a day so I can say that
John has done something that is one for
the record books
he ate 10 hamburgers in a day quite a
remarkable achievement isn't it so
depending on what you have achieved
which is something set to create a
record you will call that as being one
for the record books let's look at some
more expressions with the very common
word called book well the next one is
hit the books well what is it like to
hit the books sometimes you wish you
could do that right well hit the books
is nothing but to study very hard so
it's an expression telling someone to
stop goofing around stop playing around
and study hard so you can tell someone
like look tomorrow is your final
examination stop goofing around and hit
the books which means start studying
very hard it's an expression to tell
someone that stop everything study hard
the next one is going by the book okay
going by the book actually means to
follow the exact rules and procedures so
there are some people when driving they
go by the book they go by the actual
driving rules they stop at a red light
you know they go a little fast they go a
little slow when there's a yellow light
but people like me don't like to go by
the book because we do not follow
her rules and the procedures so going by
the book basically means to follow the
exact rule up to the exact detail okay
and our next expression is booked a
flight well
booking a flight or maybe a hotel room
is nothing but reserved reserved a
flight or a hotel room because when you
reserved or booked a flight or a hotel
room in advance then you are short of
getting the service as opposed to
getting it immediately okay and then we
have cook the books now cook the books
is a very negative term it basically is
used to talk about you know creating
false data or false information while
making the accounts of a company so this
is what some accountants in most big
organizations also are guilty of doing
so they kind of tend to you know create
false data create false information when
the where the financial account
information is concerned and that way
they end up making more money than what
is actually supposed to be the case so
you can say something like mr. Waide
will never become a successful
accountant because he always cooks the
books or mr. Waide has made a lot of
money because he has always cooked the
books okay so that's a negative term you
used for someone who kind of you know
does not do very well legally with the
financial information and our next
expression is a very common one it says
don't judge a book by its cover
well a book if it has a nice cover you
kind of think it's very nice it's very
interesting but don't be
foolish okay judging a book by its cover
basically means you don't have to make
opinions or make judgments based on
someone's appearance or based on
someone's looks so there are people who
wear a lot of tattoos and people think
that oh this guy's got a lot of tattoos
a lot of piercings he may be a druggie
but don't judge a book by it's cover
don't think he is a bad person
he's a druggie or an addict just because
he has a lot of tattoos so you don't
judge someone based on their looks
okay well that's it from me on this
lesson on expressions using the word
book well I'll be back with some more
